title: about
text:
research
I work as an ocean scientist on the California Oceans Program at The Nature Conservancy. I provide scientific leadership and technical expertise across the program ensuring our strategies are data-driven and grounded in the best available science. Much of my work focuses on using remote sensing and near-real time data analytics to unlock conservation opportunities including addressing statewide plastic pollution, accelerating the pace and scale of ecosystem restoration, and addressing unsustainable bycatch in Pacific fisheries.

leisure
In my free time I enjoy exploring with friends from hiking local trails, to finding secret waves, getting lost in the forest and everything in between. I love the first sun of spring and feeling the warmth sink all the way to my bones, the sound rocks make as the ocean waves recede, and the smell of a Redwood forest.

welcome
My name is Sara and I work as an ocean scientist at The Nature Conservancy (TNC) in California. Professionally, my work focuses on using remote sensing and near-real time data analytics to support decision-making and unlock new opportunities for policy, research, and action.
